title: Father charged with murder of his disabled son 16 years after the nine-year-old's disappearance
text:
It has been 16 years since a nine-year-old disabled boy from Missouri vanished without a trace while in the care of his father, who is now charged in the child’s presumed death.

St. Louis County prosecutors last week charged 46-year-old Dawan Ferguson with first-degree murder. He is being held without bond.

The suspect's son, Christian Ferguson, had a rare disorder that prevented his body from processing protein. As a result of his condition, the child could not walk or talk.

Dawan Ferguson, 46 (left), has been charged with first-degree murder in the presumed death of his son, Christian Ferguson, in June 2003

The boy, pictured with his mother, Theda Person, suffered from a rare disorder that prevented his body from processing protein

A probable cause statement cited by St Louis Post-Dispatch says Dawan Ferguson, a former bounty hunter, failed to provide Christian with proper medication and nutrition for more than two years, before leaving home with the child on June 11, 2003. Christian was never seen again.

Court documents say he would have died within 48 hours without proper medication. Christian's body has not been found.

Authorities have not said what led to charges being filed at this time, but at a press conference on Friday, St. Louis County Prosecutor Wesley Bell said Ferguson's arrest came after a weeks-long review of the case.

Christian’s mother, Theda Person, attended the news conference announcing Ferguson's arrest and told reporters she was 'totally overwhelmed' by this latest development and feeling a mix of emotions.

'I knew that justice was on its way, but I’m in shock,' she said. 'I feel supported and I’m excited. I’m a lot of different things right now because I don’t know how to be in this place, but I’m glad that I’m here.'

Ferguson on June 11, 2003, called 911 from a pay phone to report that his SUV had been carjacked with his son inside. The vehicle was found empty two hours later

Christina Ferguson would have died within 48 hours without proper medication

At around 6am on June 11, 2003, Dawan Ferguson made a 911 call from a pay phone in St Louis, saying that his maroon 1999 Ford Expedition had been carjacked with his son inside.

Ferguson described Christian as wearing a diaper and wrapped in a blanket.

Two hours later, police tracked down the missing SUV 5 miles from where Ferguson reported the alleged car theft, but there was no sign of the boy.

A neighbor told investigators she had seen the Ford SUV parked in the same location for hours, including around the time of Ferguson's 911 call.

When interviewed by police, Ferguson reportedly cut the conversation short and refused to take a polygraph test.

Police also noted that the man had a cellphone on him, but chose to use a pay phone to report the alleged carjacking,

Cops searched Ferguson's rental home twice but found no evidence related to Christian's disappearance.

At the time of the incident, Ferguson was locked in a legal battle with his ex-wife over the custody of the their two children.
description: Dawan Ferguson, 46 (left), from St Louis, has been charged with first-degree murder in the presumed death of his son, Christian Ferguson (right), in June 2003. The boy's body was never recovered.
